data.event: Clifton is an incorporated town located in southwestern Fairfax County, Virginia, United States, with a population of 282 at the time of the 2010 Census.

event.title: Incorporated by the General Assembly on March 9, 1902

data.event: Incorporated by the General Assembly on March 9, 1902, Clifton is currently one of only three towns in the county, the other two being Vienna and Herndon.
Development of a village at the siding began in 1868 when a railroad depot, named Clifton Station, was constructed.

event.title: edged near the area in the late 1970s

data.event: Consequently, as development edged near the area in the late 1970s and early 1980, an ordinance was enacted stating that only one building could be placed on 5-acre (20,000 m2) parcels that have not already been divided.

Consequently, as development edged near the area in the late 1970s and early 1980, an ordinance was enacted stating that only one building could be placed on 5-acre (20,000 m2) parcels that have not already been divided.

event.title: Today, the southern and eastern portions of the area are heavily forested

data.event: Today, the southern and eastern portions of the area are heavily forested, with single-family homes, while the northern area became equestrian areas.
